structured.description: A React JSX element "Code" that takes two properties: children and className. The children property represents the content of the element, while the className property is an optional string that specifies a CSS class for the element. The function returns a JSX element with the specified class name and contains the provided child content.

items.description: Takes two properties, `children` and `className`, and returns a JSX element representing an HTML code element. It sets the class name of the code element to the provided value and wraps the provided children within it.

params.name: obj
params.description: Destructured into two properties: `children` and `className`. The `children` property expects an instance of `React.ReactNode`, which can be any React element, while `className` is optional and accepts a string.

params.name: obj.children
params.description: Required for rendering code inside JSX.

returns.description: A React element representing an HTML code element (`<code>`) with potentially overridden class name and enclosed child content.

usage.description: It wraps the content with a `<code>` tag, and applies the specified class name.

items.name: Code
